intro: Mentzelia involucrata var. megalantha, commonly known as the giant blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is known for its distinctive, showy inflorescence. The variety megalantha is distinguished by its larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other varieties of Mentzelia involucrata.
